QuestionStatement: In the short run, the firm will realize an economic loss but will continue to produce if the price is
Which of the following MUST be true in the long run?
AnswerChoices: The equilibrium price will be P2, since that is where marginal cost equals minimum average variable cost
The equilibrium price will be above P3, since firms must make an economic profit to stay in business
If the price is above P2, new firms will enter _the industry
If the price is above P3, new firms will enter _the industry
If the price is above P4, firms will exit the _industry

QuestionStatement: Which of the following MUST be true of the long run?
AnswerChoices: It is at least one year in duration
All factors of production are variable
At least one factor of production is fixed

QuestionStatement: Which of the following market structures results in allocative efficiency?
An entrepreneur has earned enough total revenue to cover her accounting costs, but economic losses are being incurred. What must be true?
AnswerChoices: Her accounting costs are larger than her economic costs
Her accounting profits are less than her implicit costs
Her accounting profits are greater than her economic costs
Her economic losses are less than her total fixed costs
Her implicit costs are less than her accounting costs

As output of a firm increases, the difference between the firm’s average total cost and its average variable cost gets smaller because the firm’s
AnswerChoices: marginal product of labor is decreasing
long-run average total cost is decreasing

Marginal revenue is the change in revenue that results from a one-unit increase in the
Which of the following statements has to be true in a perfectly competitive market?
AnswerChoices: A firm’s marginal revenue equals price
A firm’s average total cost is above price in the long run
A firm’s average fixed cost rises in the short run
A firm’s average variable cost is higher than price in the long run

QuestionStatement: Assume that an electric power company owns two plants and that, on a particular day, 10,000 kilowatts of electricity are demanded by the public.  In order to minimize the total cost of providing the 10,000 kilowatts, the company should allocate production so that
AnswerChoices: Marginal costs are the same for both plants
Average total costs are the same for both plants
Total variable costs are the same for both plants
The sum of total variable cost and total fixed cost is the same for both plants
Only the plant with the lower average cost is used to produce the 10,000 kilowatts of electricity

AnswerChoices: Marginal revenue equals average total cost

AnswerChoices: Decrease its output slightly but increase its profit margin
Lose more by continuing to produce than by shutting down

QuestionStatement: Which of the following statements is true of perfectly competitive firms in long-run equilibrium?
AnswerChoices: Firm revenues will decrease if production is increased
Total firm revenues are at a maximum
Average fixed cost equals marginal cost
Average total cost is at a minimum
Average variable cost is greater than marginal cost

Which of the following is true if a perfectly competitive industry is earning zero economic profits in the long run?
AnswerChoices: The level of investment in long-run equilibrium is greater than the efficient level
Relatively few firms are able to survive the competitive pressures in the long run
Some firms will be forced to transfer their resources to more lucrative uses
The resources invested in this industry are earning at least as high a return as they would in any alternative use
Firms will exit until economic profits become positive
